title: Country
source: Our World in Data - Regions (2025)

title: Year
source: Our World in Data - Regions (2025)

title: ISO code
source: International Organization for Standardization - Regions (2023)

title: Population
description: Population by country, available from 10,000 BCE to 2100, based on data and estimates from different sources.
source: Population based on various sources (2024) [https://ourworldindata.org/population-sources]

title: Gross domestic product (GDP)
description: Total economic output of a country or region per year. This data is adjusted for inflation and differences in living costs between countries.
source: Bolt and van Zanden – Maddison Project Database 2023 [https://www.rug.nl/ggdc/historicaldevelopment/maddison/releases/maddison-project-database-2023]

title: Annual percentage change in coal consumption
source: Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2025) [https://www.energyinst.org/statistical-review/]

title: Annual change in coal consumption
source: Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2025) [https://www.energyinst.org/statistical-review/]

title: Coal consumption per capita
source: Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2025) [https://www.energyinst.org/statistical-review/]; Population based on various sources (2024) [https://ourworldindata.org/population-sources]

title: Primary energy consumption from coal
source: Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2025) [https://www.energyinst.org/statistical-review/]

title: Electricity generation from coal per person
source: Ember - Yearly Electricity Data Europe (2026) [https://ember-energy.org/data/yearly-electricity-data/]; Ember - Yearly Electricity Data (2026) [https://ember-energy.org/data/yearly-electricity-data/]; Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2025) [https://www.energyinst.org/statistical-review/]; Population based on various sources (2024) [https://ourworldindata.org/population-sources]

title: Electricity generation from coal
source: Ember - Yearly Electricity Data Europe (2026) [https://ember-energy.org/data/yearly-electricity-data/]; Ember - Yearly Electricity Data (2026) [https://ember-energy.org/data/yearly-electricity-data/]; Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2025) [https://www.energyinst.org/statistical-review/]

title: Annual change in coal production
description: Measured as a percentage of the previous year's production.
source: Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2025) [https://www.energyinst.org/statistical-review/]; The Shift Data Portal - Energy production from fossil fuels (2019) [https://www.theshiftdataportal.org/]

title: Annual change in coal production
source: Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2025) [https://www.energyinst.org/statistical-review/]; The Shift Data Portal - Energy production from fossil fuels (2019) [https://www.theshiftdataportal.org/]

title: Coal production per capita
source: Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2025) [https://www.energyinst.org/statistical-review/]; The Shift Data Portal - Energy production from fossil fuels (2019) [https://www.theshiftdataportal.org/]; Population based on various sources (2024) [https://ourworldindata.org/population-sources]

title: Coal production
source: Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2025) [https://www.energyinst.org/statistical-review/]; The Shift Data Portal - Energy production from fossil fuels (2019) [https://www.theshiftdataportal.org/]

title: Share of electricity generated by coal
description: Measured as a percentage of total electricity produced in the country or region.
source: Ember - Yearly Electricity Data Europe (2026) [https://ember-energy.org/data/yearly-electricity-data/]; Ember - Yearly Electricity Data (2026) [https://ember-energy.org/data/yearly-electricity-data/]; Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2025) [https://www.energyinst.org/statistical-review/]

title: Share of primary energy consumption that comes from coal
description: Measured as a percentage of the total primary energy, using the substitution method.
source: Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2025) [https://www.energyinst.org/statistical-review/]

title: Annual percentage change in fossil fuel consumption
source: Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2025) [https://www.energyinst.org/statistical-review/]

title: Annual change in fossil fuel consumption
source: Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2025) [https://www.energyinst.org/statistical-review/]

title: Electricity generation from fossil fuels per person
description: Electricity generation from coal, oil, and gas, measured in kilowatt-hours per person.
source: Ember - Yearly Electricity Data Europe (2026) [https://ember-energy.org/data/yearly-electricity-data/]; Ember - Yearly Electricity Data (2026) [https://ember-energy.org/data/yearly-electricity-data/]; Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2025) [https://www.energyinst.org/statistical-review/]; Population based on various sources (2024) [https://ourworldindata.org/population-sources]

title: Electricity generation from fossil fuels
description: Electricity generation from coal, oil, and gas, measured in terawatt-hours.
source: Ember - Yearly Electricity Data Europe (2026) [https://ember-energy.org/data/yearly-electricity-data/]; Ember - Yearly Electricity Data (2026) [https://ember-energy.org/data/yearly-electricity-data/]; Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2025) [https://www.energyinst.org/statistical-review/]

title: Fossil fuel consumption per capita
source: Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2025) [https://www.energyinst.org/statistical-review/]; Population based on various sources (2024) [https://ourworldindata.org/population-sources]

title: Primary energy consumption from fossil fuels
source: Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2025) [https://www.energyinst.org/statistical-review/]

title: Share of electricity generated by fossil fuels
description: Electricity generation from coal, oil, and gas, measured as a percentage of total electricity produced in the country or region.
source: Ember - Yearly Electricity Data Europe (2026) [https://ember-energy.org/data/yearly-electricity-data/]; Ember - Yearly Electricity Data (2026) [https://ember-energy.org/data/yearly-electricity-data/]; Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2025) [https://www.energyinst.org/statistical-review/]

title: Share of primary energy consumption that comes from fossil fuels
description: Measured as a percentage of the total primary energy, using the substitution method.
source: Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2025) [https://www.energyinst.org/statistical-review/]

title: Lifecycle emissions from electricity generation
description: Measured in megatonnes of CO₂ equivalents.
source: Ember - Yearly Electricity Data Europe (2026) [https://ember-energy.org/data/yearly-electricity-data/]; Ember - Yearly Electricity Data (2026) [https://ember-energy.org/data/yearly-electricity-data/]
